content: An error has been encountered. Please contact your administrator.

comment.text: This translation key "BackupCreatedError" is used to display an error message when a backup file upload fails. The message appears in a toast notification when uploading a local file and the upload process has not completed successfully.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Czech translation uses 'Vašeho Administrátora'. It's more natural and common to use the more informal 'jeho Administrátora' or 'správce' (administrator) in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Došlo k chybě. Prosím kontaktujte jeho Administrátora. / Došlo k chybě. Prosím kontaktujte správce.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "On tapahtunut jokin outo virhe. Tosi outo. Ota yhteys järjestelmänvalvojaan." is overly informal and deviates significantly from the original English content's professional tone.  The repetition of "Tosi outo" (Really weird) is unnecessary and unprofessional for an error message.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: On tapahtunut virhe. Ota yhteys järjestelmänvalvojaan.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translated phrase is too verbose and conversational for a system error message. It lacks the conciseness expected in technical communication.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Keep the translation concise and professional, similar to the original 'An error has been encountered. Please contact your administrator.'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation uses a very formal and slightly awkward phrasing. The use of 'しまいました' implies a sense of regret or surprise, which may not be appropriate for a generic error message.  '連絡ください' is also overly formal. A more natural and polite phrasing would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: エラーが発生しました。管理者にお問い合わせください。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While '連絡ください' translates literally to 'Please contact', it's more natural to use 'お問い合わせください' in this context, which is the standard phrasing for 'Please contact' when referring to customer support or administrator contact.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 管理者にお問い合わせください

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ພົບຂໍ້ຜິດພາດ. ກະລຸນາຕິດຕໍ່ຜູ້ເບິ່ງແຍງລະບົບຂອງເຈົ້າ.' is a literal translation, but 'ຜູ້ເບິ່ງແຍງລະບົບຂອງເຈົ້າ' (your system administrator) is overly formal and specific for a general error message. It might be better to use a more general term for 'administrator'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ພົບຂໍ້ຜິດພາດ. ກະລຸນາຕິດຕໍ່ຜູ້ປົກຄອງ.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'පරිපාලක' (paripalaka) is a direct transliteration of 'administrator' but might sound slightly unnatural in Sinhala. A more common and natural word for 'administrator' in this context would be 'ඇඳුනි' (adunne) or 'පහසුකාරයා' (pahasukariyaa).
The word 'Наишла' should be 'Догодила' or 'Појавила се'. 'Наишла' means 'arrived' and doesn't fit the context of an error.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Догодила је грешка. Молимо контактирајте вашег администратора.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'naišla' is incorrect. It should be 'nastala'. 'Naišla' means 'arrived' or 'found', while 'nastala' means 'occurred' or 'arose'.
